data.meanings: to conceal, to cover, to reject, to disbelieve, to be thankless, unthankful, ungrateful, to disown, deny, faithless, black horse, dark night, tiller/farmer. [[Perhaps it should be noted that its primary meaning is to cover/conceal (hence farmer), with active/conscious intent. From this, is born: to reject/disbelieve because this is a conscious decision made by a person. Please note one can only reject something after hearing/seeing/experiencing it, not before.]]
data.sentence: The word كَفَرُوا comes from the root ك ف ر and is associated with the meanings: to conceal, to cover, to reject, to disbelieve, to be thankless, unthankful, ungrateful, to disown, deny, faithless, black horse, dark night, tiller/farmer. [[Perhaps it should be noted that its primary meaning is to cover/conceal (hence farmer), with active/conscious intent. From this, is born: to reject/disbelieve because this is a conscious decision made by a person. Please note one can only reject something after hearing/seeing/experiencing it, not before.]]

data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهَ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: fire, flame, heat, war, light, shine, sparkle, irritate, vex or provoke war.
data.sentence: The word نَارًا comes from the root ن و ر and is associated with the meanings: fire, flame, heat, war, light, shine, sparkle, irritate, vex or provoke war.

data.meanings: To lose father and child, lose direct heirs, be weary, tired, weak, have only remote relations.
data.sentence: The word كُلَّمَا comes from the root ك ل ل and is associated with the meanings: To lose father and child, lose direct heirs, be weary, tired, weak, have only remote relations.

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word كَانَ comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.
data.sentence: The word الْعَذَابَ comes from the root ع ذ ب and is associated with the meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.

data.meanings: to warm at the fire, endure heat, to roast/fry/broil/burn.
data.sentence: The word نُصْلِيهِمْ comes from the root ص ل ي and is associated with the meanings: to warm at the fire, endure heat, to roast/fry/broil/burn.
The word نَضِجَتْ comes from the root ن ض ج and is associated with the meanings: to be thoroughly burnt.

data.meanings: To hit/hurt/beat the skin, to strike, flog with a whip, fall down, to compel, to be hardy/strong/sturdy, to be enduring or patient, to contend with someone, constrain/compel/necessitate.
data.sentence: The word جُلُودُهُمْ comes from the root ج ل د and is associated with the meanings: To hit/hurt/beat the skin, to strike, flog with a whip, fall down, to compel, to be hardy/strong/sturdy, to be enduring or patient, to contend with someone, constrain/compel/necessitate.

data.meanings: changing/altering -> with or without substitution, replacing/exchanging.
data.sentence: The word بَدَّلْنَاهُمْ comes from the root ب د ل and is associated with the meanings: changing/altering -> with or without substitution, replacing/exchanging.

data.meanings: To hit/hurt/beat the skin, to strike, flog with a whip, fall down, to compel, to be hardy/strong/sturdy, to be enduring or patient, to contend with someone, constrain/compel/necessitate.
data.sentence: The word جُلُودًا comes from the root ج ل د and is associated with the meanings: To hit/hurt/beat the skin, to strike, flog with a whip, fall down, to compel, to be hardy/strong/sturdy, to be enduring or patient, to contend with someone, constrain/compel/necessitate.

data.meanings: bring, convey, benefit, bestowed upon; alter or change a thing for the worse, corrupted, tainted, infected, render it ill-smelling; adjusting, repairing; difference between two persons; become jealous; procure; other than (exclusively), except, without; lies; [a man’s] dislike of another’s participation in what supposedly his right; care of what is sacred or inviolable to avoid suspicion of disdain; cognizance or badge of a free non-Muslim subjects in a Muslim government; one who puts off the furniture of his camel from off him to relieve and ease him. mughiraat - raiders.
data.sentence: The word غَيْرَهَا comes from the root غ ي ر and is associated with the meanings: bring, convey, benefit, bestowed upon; alter or change a thing for the worse, corrupted, tainted, infected, render it ill-smelling; adjusting, repairing; difference between two persons; become jealous; procure; other than (exclusively), except, without; lies; [a man’s] dislike of another’s participation in what supposedly his right; care of what is sacred or inviolable to avoid suspicion of disdain; cognizance or badge of a free non-Muslim subjects in a Muslim government; one who puts off the furniture of his camel from off him to relieve and ease him. mughiraat - raiders.

data.meanings: to taste/experience/try/perceive. One who tastes, cause to taste.
data.sentence: The word لِيَذُوقُوا comes from the root ذ و ق and is associated with the meanings: to taste/experience/try/perceive. One who tastes, cause to taste.

data.meanings: mighty/potent/powerful/strong, noble/honourable/glorious, resisted/withstood, invincible, overcome (e.g. in argument), exalt, prevail, highly esteemed, precious, glory, vanity, excellent, proud and hard manner, stern.. uzza - name of an idol of the pagan Arabs regarded by them as God's daughter.. . 'Azza (prf. 3rd. m. sing. asim. V): Prevailed.. 'Azzaznaa (prf. 1st. pl. II): We strengthened.. Tu'izzu (impf. 2nd. m. pl. II): thou honour, confer honour and dignity.. 'Izzan (v. n.): source of strength.. 'Izzatun (v. n.): vain pride, false prestige or sense of self respect, might honour, power.. Al-Aziizun (act. pic. m. sing.): All-Mighty, One of the names of Allah, Unassailable, invincible, powerful in evidences and arguments, strong, mighty, heavy (with 'alaa: tell hard upon).. A'azzu (elative): more powerful, that occupies stronger and more respectable position.. A'izzatan (n. pl.): most respectable and powerful, its sing. is 'Aziiyun.
data.sentence: The word عَزِيزًا comes from the root ع ز ز and is associated with the meanings: mighty/potent/powerful/strong, noble/honourable/glorious, resisted/withstood, invincible, overcome (e.g. in argument), exalt, prevail, highly esteemed, precious, glory, vanity, excellent, proud and hard manner, stern.. uzza - name of an idol of the pagan Arabs regarded by them as God's daughter.. . 'Azza (prf. 3rd. m. sing. asim. V): Prevailed.. 'Azzaznaa (prf. 1st. pl. II): We strengthened.. Tu'izzu (impf. 2nd. m. pl. II): thou honour, confer honour and dignity.. 'Izzan (v. n.): source of strength.. 'Izzatun (v. n.): vain pride, false prestige or sense of self respect, might honour, power.. Al-Aziizun (act. pic. m. sing.): All-Mighty, One of the names of Allah, Unassailable, invincible, powerful in evidences and arguments, strong, mighty, heavy (with 'alaa: tell hard upon).. A'azzu (elative): more powerful, that occupies stronger and more respectable position.. A'izzatan (n. pl.): most respectable and powerful, its sing. is 'Aziiyun.
